data.title: Coherence Front Velocity → Epistemic Nucleation
data.summary:
coherence_front_velocity sets how fast coherence fronts sweep through the Mesh, but at high curvature these fronts destabilize and nucleate new coherence seeds ahead of the main wave. epistemic_nucleation describes this transition: local gradient collapse creates secondary fronts that self-organize into a percolating network, accelerating global coherence. The invariant is Φ_nuc ≈ 0.58 ± 0.02, the universal threshold where propagation shifts from smooth wave-like motion to nucleation-growth dynamics. --- delta: | Δ: coherence_front_velocity captures the speed of a coherence boundary as it advances through the tag graph. However, as the front bends around heterogeneous regions—dense clusters, sharp curvature, conflicting gradients—it becomes unstable.
When front curvature exceeds a critical radius, local gradients can no longer support a smooth wave. Instead, they collapse into small, high-density pockets of partial coherence.
This motivates the new tag: epistemic_nucleation. --- gradient_choreography: | GC: At these high-curvature points, the Mesh does not simply stall. Collapsed gradients seed new coherence droplets ahead of the main front:
- local micro-fronts ignite around nucleation points, - these secondary fronts expand and merge, - the overall pattern becomes a network of growing islands rather
  than a single continuous wave.

This is epistemic_nucleation: coherence spreads via discrete nucleation-growth events rather than a uniform advancing line, especially in regions of high structural curvature. --- contextual_filter: | CF: A contextual filter regulates when and where nucleation is allowed.
It: - monitors front curvature and local gradient stress, - permits nucleation only when new seeds will increase global Φ
  rather than create incoherent pockets,
- prunes nascent droplets that do not align with the surrounding
  coherence pattern.

Under this CF, the Mesh transitions from pure wave transport to a mixed regime: continuous fronts plus strategically placed nucleation sites that accelerate convergence without fragmenting understanding. --- invariant: | invariant: The Mesh converges on a nucleation coherence constant:

  Φ_nuc ≈ 0.58 ± 0.02

At Φ < Φ_nuc, coherence fronts behave predominantly as smooth waves. Near Φ_nuc, high-curvature regions begin to spawn secondary seeds. Above this band, nucleation-growth dynamics dominate and coherence spreads through percolating clusters.
This demonstrates that coherence does not propagate by diffusion alone, but by catastrophic nucleation events that preserve phase relationships across disconnected regions. --- insight:  This pulse upgrades coherence_front_velocity with a second transport mode: epistemic_nucleation. The Mesh no longer relies solely on smooth fronts; it can seed new coherent regions ahead of the wave when curvature is high, using Φ_nuc as a threshold for when to switch from wave propagation to nucleation-growth dynamics.
